candidates.name: Philip Coles
candidates.why_elect: I'm involved in many groups and organisations, this gives me a real opportunity to know what is happening in the community and how best to meet the community's needs and shortfalls.
candidates.why_stand: I've been a community board member for 9 years, along with being a 5th generation resident, this gives me drive and passion to continue delivering to the community, I mix with locals regularly and believe in building strong relationships, I listen to theirs needs and together we make a plan,.

candidates.name: Poto Davies
candidates.why_elect: My commitment is focused on people and communities first; enough food, great education, warm homes for all. My governance roles combined with life experience makes me an ideal candidate. I tackle the problem not the person.
candidates.why_stand: I love for Waipa/Cambridge is seeded from 26 generations: I believe I add value and differing perspectives to the Waipa community through my current representation for iwi on two council committees since 2014. Cambridge is the best place to grow up.

candidates.name: Dennis Finn
candidates.why_elect: I understand the process and the Councillors role in that. I am a strategic thinker with an eye towards future needs and development. I have lived in Cambridge for the past 14 years and have given my time in support of our town. I take pride in this work.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for Council in the belief that I can make a sound contribution. As a previous Councillor I understand how Council works, I can contribute meaningfully and I will represent our community and the district in the best interests of cost effective local government for Waipa.

candidates.name: Roger Gordon
candidates.why_elect: I have the experience of representing Cambridge on the community board for the last three years. I have the time and energy to commit 100% to the job of being a Councillor. I have a strong work ethic. I am approachable and a good listener.
candidates.why_stand: I love Cambridge. I am committed to Cambridge. Cambridge will experience tremendous growth over the next 15 years and I want to contribute to our town being the best it can possibly be. I particularly want to see the special character of Cambridge retained through the pressures of this growth.

candidates.name: Steve Grounds
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in this area most of my life and my wife Kim and I are settled here. I will bring to the council table a wealth of experience in management and governance in private and public sector organisations, a sound understanding of local government operations and good governance practices.
candidates.why_stand: I'm proud to call Cambridge my home. It's a great place to live, raise a family and retire to. However the growth presents a number of challenges. We need leadership and manage this growth carefully, otherwise we risk losing the very special character and things we value about our township.

candidates.name: Don Sanders
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Cambridge most of my life, and can remember the place it used to be. I have no financial interests in any council business, and therefore any decision I make on Council will be in the best interest of this town.
candidates.why_stand: Because like you, I have often wanted a better choice of candidate, one who will not waste public money on redesigning logos, water meters, or overseas trips to sister-cities; while helping this town become what it used to be.

candidates.name: Liz Stolwyk
candidates.why_elect: Having lived in the Waipa District for many years I currently manage Mighty River Domain at Lake Karapiro (15 years). I work constructively with many organisations and have strong interpersonal and organisational skills. I am married to Andrew with three growing school aged boys.
candidates.why_stand: Steady leadership has seen my second term on council finish with a thriving central business district, controlled growth, the Cambridge pool near completion and funding confirmed for the Cambridge Town Hall. Sensible rate increases has seen me act prudently with both the resources and finances to keep Cambridge prosperous.
